ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 4 - 6 hours/week
5-8 hours depending on the homework assignment and project due date
6-7 hours
Approximately 15-20 hours a week.
8 hours spend reviewing material and working on homework assignments.
about 10 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Very important but complicated subject. However, the instructor was good when sticking to her slides, but seemed to go off on tangents when asked questions or when giving examples.Overall good treatments of very difficult topics.
I thought this was a good course. Martha's TA sessions are a must. I even think that they should be held weekly so we can cover more techniques of longitudinal data analysis in SAS.

The material was good, the workload and the assignments were fair. The instructor was often difficult to understand and at times she had trouble striking a balance between the theoretical and practical aspects of the course material.
Hard material. Not sure of how to make it easier to understand
The class sessions were very helpful (both by the instructor and the TA). It provided a nice balance of theory/explanation and applied applications.
Learned alot

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Haiqun Lin  Homeworks were not screened/editted as much as they should have been. Small errors caused great confusion.

Instructor: Haiqun Lin  Dr. Lin was a good instructor. She clearly cares about her students and puts a lot of effort into answering student questions.On a minor note - next year, please post the slides as a powerpoint so that students can manipulate the size that they are printed, how many to a page, and the order. I'm sure they will appreciate it.

Instructor: Haiqun Lin  The instructor is clearly very knowledgeable about the course material. She is clearly also a very kind person. However, the instructor was often difficult to understand and at times she had trouble striking a balance between the theoretical and practical aspects of the course material.
Instructor: Haiqun Lin  She was fine. Difficult material is the tough part.

Instructor: Haiqun Lin  Dr. Lin explained the concepts very clearly and was very knowledgeable. Her course slides were well-prepared and helpful.Sometimes the class would run 5 - 10 minutes over the allotted time (not a big deal but some people have class after).
Instructor: Haiqun Lin  Very energetic and teaches with passion

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Excellent. Martha clarified a lot of what we were learning. Her handouts were top notch.
Martha is a great TA. She is responsive and professional. I would highly recommend her to TA any course in BIS in the future.
The TA (Martha Skup) was excellent. She was very helpful both inside and outside of course sessions and her instruction was very straightforward.
Martha was great. Her lab materials were extremely helpful and she was always great with answer questions both in and out of lab section.
Martha was fantastic
Martha is an incredible TA - very helpful and prepared great SAS sessions.
Very very helpful, one of the best TAs

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Very challenging, but vital to know. Worth taking.
This courseis an introduction to longitudinal data analysis. It gives a base for students then to work off of for future longitudinal research.
I would recommend the course. I learned more about several topics in which I was interested, which ultimately, is the main way to evaluate a course.
If necessary, but the material is tough and might not apply to everyone
Very interesting course - I would definitely recommend.
Very good course, you will learn much and everybody is helpful and generous
